Extended Tetris

Taking pieces beyond x and y shifts

    Into the Future

  • You're just going to have to wait, you know. In the meantime, checkout: Inquisition, Why Validations Suck in 96, Java Gems, or just google for some random images (not helping with that).

    • Check me out!

    Riot for fast ruby testing, Jubilator for GitHub browsing, Seota for semi-automatic SEO help, Animal Cracker for Rack asset hosting assistance, Chicago for Sinatra helpers

Jan 14, 2010

First person tetris, what a trip (thanks Assaf). I’m glad I do not have to rotate my world around in order to put something on a shelf. Playing it got me thinking, though. The thought was, “What would the pieces look like if the individual blocks were not forced to meet along their edges?” As in, what if the blocks could meet at their corners.

Whelp, here’s how. I might be missing a few, but whatever. That would be one hell of game.
